East Rockingham High School is located in Elkton, Virginia, United States; it is part of Rockingham County Public Schools and opened in August 2010. It relieved a severe overcrowding problem at Spotswood High School, which currently houses around 950 students. East Rockingham competes athletically in the VHSL Group A Bull Run District and Region B. The principal is Marc Sweigart. The assistant principals are Barbara Eanes and Brandy Strickler. The school's mascot is the Eagle and their school colors are red and black. The main rival of East Rockingham is Spotswood.
